page.title: 11BLACKMORE VALE LOCAL SPORTS
page.content: Here are no local amenities for indoor sports nor football pitches but the local people have their own forms of recreation.In the winter,foxhunting, when the local hunt,The Blackmore Vale and Sparkford hounds chase the fox across the open fields,followed by huntsmen.As few poultry are kept the numerous foxes do little harm but old traditions must be kept alive.It is quite a spectacle to see the men in hunting pink following the hounds in full cry. In the autumn pheasant and rabbit Shoots are organised. Young birds are seen and rabbits abound. The parts of the waterways rented by the local angling society provide very quiet fishing for chub and perch.The nearby bigger River Stour would be usually more popular. Winter evening entertainment involves lengthy journeys or home activities.
